item.description:
OK, OK, really last minute with this one... A roughly 2 hr. easy looping hike (just slight rolling) at Northwest Park in Windsor. We'll pass through field, forest, and nice evergreen forest with views of the reservoir about half way through.

Meet in front of the Nature Center (see map) at 11 AM and we'll hike from there and take various trails or portions of trails as conditions allow. We'll definatly hit the Rainbow Reservoir trail for the views and back to the parking lot.

Children and leashed dogs are welcome.

Better yet, optionally come early as there is a pancake breakfast held at the park from 8 AM to 11 AM with real maple syrup made at the park! I (Kevin) will be there at about 10 AM.

Annual Pancake Breakfast

Wake up and head to Northwest Park this morning for the annual Friends of Northwest Park Pancake Breakfast from 8 AM to 11 AM in the Warming Shed (see map). You can arrive any time after 8 AM but no later than 10 AM. Bring an appetite for a full breakfast of pancakes and sausage smothered in 100% pure maple syrup made right at Windsor’s very own Northwest Park. Refreshment choices include orange juice, coffee, tea and hot chocolate. $5.00 for adults and $4.00 for children under 6.  Please call 285-1886 to register (bit too late to register so just head to the park and make the best of it).

 


General directions:
* From Interstate 91 heading north, take Exit 38. From Interstate 91 heading south, take Exit 38A.
* Turn right at the exit on to Poquonock Avenue (Route 75).
* Go about 1.5 miles and turn left on to Prospect Hill Rd.
* Turn right at the traffic circle on to Lang Road
* Continue up the road to the Nature Center parking lot.

Approximate location/directions (103 Lang Rd., Windsor, CT):
http://www.mapquest.com/maps/%5B76-103%5D+Lang+Rd+Windsor+CT+06095/

Trail map:
http://www.northwestpark.org/pdf/New_NWP_Map.pdf

Northwest Park and programs:
http://www.northwestpark.org/

 


=== Legal Stuff ===
By clicking on "Count me in" or "Yes" or "Maybe" for this event you agree, warrant, and covenant as follows:

In consideration for accepting this entry, I, the registrant, intending to be legally bound, hereby, for myself, my heirs, my executors and administrators, do waive and release any and all rights for damages I may have against any parties or persons connected with the Hartford Area Hiking meetup group for and related to the above listed event. I attest and verify that I am physically fit to participate in any portion of this above listed event. I grant Hartford Area Hiking permission to use any photographs, film or videotapes of this event for any purpose.
